title: Ningbo, China
description: Well... this is the beginning. All the preparation, all the hard work up until this point pays off right now. Ningbo has been my home for the last 5 years, and now it will no longer be that way. Ningbo is a small city... only about 9,000,000 people... and I have been able to live a comfortable life as a trading company business man and a videographer. But now i can add world traveler to the list of careers and set off.

title: Ci Cheng
description: My first "stop"! A chance to try some local ningbo special food called NianGao. Literally it means "Year Tall" and symbolizes a bright future... I could not think of a better thing to eat on my first day of the trip.

title: ShaoXing, China
description: A stopover on my first day put me into ShaoXing. Its a cool little city with lots of canals and water. When you get there try the ShaoXing Jiu (yellow rice wine). But watch out... it has a kick! BTW, the hotel in the video I stayed at here is the point on the map, the New Century Hotel.

title: Hangzhou Detox
description: I spent a week at this relaxation resort, detoxifying my body with a juice fast, meditation, tai chi classes, and a daily colon cleanse.... Yippy. But for real.. it was a great activity to get me cleaned up and ready for the amazing adventure ahead.

title: Downtown Hangzhou
description: I arrived in hangzhou to the Wyndam Hotel here. Anny is still with me so we have a really nice hotel to stay at. Plus I was able to meet with my WeChat buddy Julia. I also found that my cycle trailer was broken.. and ordered a new one.

title: Linan City
description: Running out of steam I pulled into a interesting little hotel/resort off the highway in Linan. I ran into the pictured group just before stopping. What started out as a horrible room nightmare upgraded into a wholesome experience and a free dinner with the owner and some good folks!

title: Hello Anhui
description: One of my toughest rides to date. Lots of hills testing my endurance and patience... Had to call it a night on top of a slope i just could go no farther. Stayed at a nice restaurant owners place while her kids berated me with questions about the trike. Friendly people for sure.

title: Tunxi Huangshan
description: Staying in Huangshan is a two part adventure.  there is downtown and then there is the actual Huangshan Mountain.  Downtown is quiet during the day but at night is bustling with life, in particular TunXi Laojie.

title: Yellow Mountain
description: Up High into Huangshan Mountain, where even my trike was not allowed to drive, resides the picturesque huangshan mountain resorts.  From here you get an amazing view of the Mountains and easy access to the top for the famed and beautiful mountains.  Just cross your fingers it does not rain and get you stuck up there for 5 hours... haha (pictures do not do this place justice!)

title: Qimen
description: A small village/city, Qimen has a personality that is for sure.  Beautiful bridges, pleasant locals, and not any foreigners at ALL!

title: Jingdezhen
description: If you have ever bought a piece of Porcelain or fine china.... you can probably tie its roots to this city.  Claiming to be the founders of the art, the whole city wraps itself around the industry... from markets, manufacturers, painters and sculptors.

title: SanBao
description: Another day in Jingdezhen took me to Sanbao.  Not part of the ride, this was a tour on 4 wheels.... then the trip continued!

title: Yugan, Jiangxi
description: Yugan threw me a little.  On the outset it is a small bustling village with not much to offer, but when you meet the right people everything changes.  I car full of people saw me riding into town and invited me for dinner after i got settled in.  Nice restaurants cool nightlife.  It just goes to show you not to look at the surface alone.

title: NanChang
description: A pivotal point on the trip.  I am literally going to pivot from heading west to heading south from this city.  Nanchang is the capital of Jiangxi province, and is a government center in china.  A lot of big decisions get made here.  Too bad the day in the city didnt turn out better.

title: ZhangShu, JiangXi
description: Small City.. Small Stop on the way.  Long road ahead to ji'an.

title: Ji'an, Jiangxi
description: Clean city with a nice hotel.  I am going to try to get down to brass tax and punch out a video or two while i  take a couple days here.

title: The Longest Ride
description: I shot this video on my ride from Ji'an to Ganzhou... fraught with all sorts of challenges.. It was a great experience.

title: Ganzhou, China
description: A long ride ends in Ganzhou.  I rode 192 km to get here, and now it is time to look around.

title: Xinfeng
description: A trailer tragedy puts me into Xinfeng.  A nice little city with a aluminum welder that helped me get back on the road. I tried to go to a bar, but everything in the city is closed up before 10 pm.. so it seems.

title: Longnan, Jiangxi
description: Into Longnan, A quick night over.  The trailer is holding together well.

title: Wudang Mountains, Jiangxi
description: Riding tired thru the hilly countryside, I decide enough is enough and find a place to sleep at a local tourist destination, some beautiful and unique round mountains.

title: Xinfeng, Guangdong
description: A days rest in the first city I visit in the GuangDong Province.  A great ride with a wonderful steady decline!  Some customs change like food and language, but it only adds to spice things up a little.

title: Huizhou
description: Huizhou, one more step till i get to Shenzhen, where i plan to camp out a bit to punch out some videos for a little bit.

title: Shenzhen, China
description: I arrived in Shenzhen a little sunburnt but no worse for ware.   I am going to set up camp here for a month to try to catch up on videos as well as get a workout regiment form my friend Josh.  He has a gym here and will teach me what it takes to get in shape to climb everest.

title: Dongguan Suburb
description: Stuck in the rain... take a day waiting it out in a suburb of Dongguan.

title: Foshan
description: Rain Rain Go away... i would like to ride more than a day.  I really need to get fenders on the trailer... all it does in the rain is flick water onto my rear panniers and my back...

title: Tragedy
description: Into each life, some rain will fall.  And today i had my fair share.  A truck rear-ended me, trashing my trailer, trike, and putting me in the hospital with a broken collarbone, sending me back to Ningbo to recover.

title: Start JaYoe 2.0
description: The JaYoe World Tour has begun again. With Ryan at my side, we set out from Ningbo yet again. What will be in store for us? Fingers crossed, trikes ready.... JaYoe!

title: Ninghai
description: Our first stop is Ninghai, where I write this now looking our into the drizzle and haze of a November day.  Ninghai is known for its hotsprings and tea fields... but we need to keep moving on south.  Ryan is faring well, this was his first long ride on the seat of a trike!  JaYoe!

title: Tired in Linhai
description: way to tired to find a good picture as we rolled into Linhai in the dark.  just enough time to post this and crash.  it was a long hilly day of rain and drizzle.... but beautiful scenery none the less.

title: Huangyan
description: A quick stop in Huangyan. Not a lot of distance gained today, but we were in beautiful country and went thru a bunch of tunnels. We even whipped out the drone and did a little flying!  Beyond that... Huangyan is a city nestled amidst green hilly countryside.  Beautiful!

title: Qingjiangzhen
description: Sore knees and drone accidents caused the early stop.  Small village along the ocean, with LOTS AND LOTS of hair salons!

title: Wenzhou
description: A long but flat day with Ryan and I starting a little late for what we wanted to do.  We rode to Wenzhou while we shared the trailer to take some pressure of my knee.  I ended up taking some of my load back to ningbo to ease the pain, which is when I got some bad news.  Forced off the trikes... we decided to try to heal up in Taiwan.

title: TaiPei, Taiwan
description: With my knee meniscus torn, I need to find something to do to kill time.  So I venture to Taiwan, where Facebook is open and the temperature warm.  Let's see whats around.  We ended up staying at the AWESOME Meander hostel right in the heart of the city.

title: So Art Hostel
description: The So Art Hostel is perched on a hill a short walk off from the train tracks.  Art deco... and full of interesting people.

title: Taichung Box Hostel
description: Found an awesome Hostel in the city, after escaping "the Unicorn".  right next to a great night market, lets eat!

title: Rui'An
description: Riding into Rui'an, a short jump out of Wenzhou.  Ryan took the weight to try to keep me free from stress.

title: Fuding
description: Stopping into Fuding, we hung for a couple days.  Hoping rain will clear before we head into mountains.  While waiting, Ryan is on a mission to replace his rear tire... again.

title: Zherong
description: A long road up was taking it out on Me and Ryan.  JaYoe!

title: Fu'an
description: Down Down and Winding Down!

title: Ningde Knee Trouble
description: ARGGGGG!  My knee is in a lot of pain.  This spells yet another pause for the JaYoe Tour.  Depressed and frustrated is an understatement.

title: Lianyungang | JaYoe 3.0
description: OK! here we go again!  lets get on the CK ferry and get out of here!

title: Ferry to Korea from China
description: The long ferry ride from Lianyungang,China to Incheon, South Korea.

title: Incheon
description: Arrived by ferry to Incheon... happy to be in Korea, but also ready to rest up for a ride tomorrow.

title: Seoul Namu Guesthouse
description: My first big ride, from Incheon to Seoul.  Lets get out there and see whats about!

title: Seoul City Hall and Protests
description: Cycling around downtown Seoul, i get an idea of the type of loud voices that argue for change in the country.

title: Golden Tulip Seoul
description: A day in Seoul... changing hotels to the Golden Tulip!

title: Korean (Chinese) Air Pollution
description: My plans changed today due to some errant smog cast off from China.  But all is well, I found a work around.

title: First Time Hammock
description: My first time setting up the Hammock and my first big ride out of Seoul.  End of an emotional day.

title: Tired Ride
description: a good ride today, wore me out completely.  lots of military preparations going on.

title: Arrive ChungJu
description: Arrive ChungJu thinking i was going to get rain but pleasantly surprised!

title: Suanbo Guesthouse
description: Ride from Chungju to Suanbo

title: Jeomchon, Mungyeong
description: Ride thru some beautiful farms to a city with lots of strange motels.

title: Bicycle Hostel at Mulryang-ri
description: Riding thru the country to Mulryang-Ri

title: Temple Relief, Songgok-ri
description: A long day with bike trouble... but a solid ending.

title: Hills to YangSan
description: hilly roads to Yangsan.  Almost to Busan.

title: Entering Busan over the hill
description: Arrived to Busan.  Over the hill... into the city.

title: Gwangalli Beach
description: Meeting a friend at the beach in Busan

title: Crashing with AIRBNB Friends
description: Staying with some awesome JaYoe Nation citizens!  Eating some life Octopus!

title: Eating A Live Octopus Whole
description: Stopped at one of Busan's awesome seafood districts for some more octopus... but i was warned it could kill me.

title: Over the hill in Busan
description: Over the hill twice!  but all worth it.

title: Arrive Jeju from Busan by Ferry
description: A nice ferry ride to Jeju!

title: Start my Jeju Ride
description: Rode the first 3rd of Jeju Island

title: Seogwi-dong
description: Day 2 around Jeju, short but eventful!

title: Windy Ride
description: A beautiful ride with lots of wind.

title: Finished cycling Jeju
description: Finished cycling around Jeju, along the way i got to meet the Haenyeo, an amazing culture of women divers.

title: Busan Fish Market
description: Arriving back to busan, spending my last day before leaving for Japan.

title: Leaving Korea
description: I leave Korea, and go over my impressions of Korea from my travels.

title: Arrived Osaka
description: The ferry arrived to Osaka... and I give my first impressions of cycling Japan.

title: Ayabe, Japan
description: Riding across to Maizuru, I stop in Ayabe.  Beautiful countryside to ride thru, and lots of tunnels.

title: Maizuru Port
description: Maizuru is a port city where i will take a ferry to Otaru and enter Hokkaido.  I made a wonderful encounter at a quaint little coffee shop before I left.

title: Ferry to Hokkaido
description: Took the ferry from Maizuru to Otaru, 21 hours on calm seas on a really big boat.

title: Otaru, Hokkaido
description: Arrived Otaru, and headed east to Sapporo.  But before I go I do a little exploring of historic Otaru.

title: Sapporo, Hokkaido
description: Sapporo is an interesting little big city.  I arrived in time to see a little of the Sapporo festival, and also reequip.

title: Leaving Sapporo
description: Head out of Sapporo headed to the north east.  This time I have some fellow tourers to keep me company.

title: Yubari, Hokkaido
description: A ride to Yubari, and a chance to test out all my new camping dear.... JaYoe!

title: Furano, Hokkaido
description: Yubari to Furano.  A city that is a skiing mecca in the winter.. but not so much in the summer.

title: Furano, Hokkaido
description: arrived Asahikawa, and spent one more night with my traveling friends... camping in a park with some nasty mosquitos.

title: Asahikawa
description: Say goodbye to my friends and buckle down to finish some videos!

title: Lake Shumarinai
description: Arrived to Lake Shumarinai to a welcome surprise after a long but beautiful ride thru the countryside.

title: Harboro
description: Back on the road again, headed to the west coast.  Haboro and an awesome rider home.

title: Teshio
description: Teshio was a real interesting rider house experience.  and one step closer to wakkanai.

title: Wakkanai Arrival
description: Welcome to Wakkanai

title: Ferry to Rishiri
description: ferry over to Rishiri to explore a small weather window.

title: Riding Around Rishiri
description: I only had a day... so i climbed the biggest mountain and ride around the whole island in a day.

title: Ferry back to Wakkanai
description: took the ferry back to Wakkanai.. almost lost the drone.. found a nice place to stay.

title: Fly out of Wakkanai
description: Returning to china for a bit.... to be continued

title: Cape Soya
description: On the road headed to Cape Soya, the northern most point of Japan.

title: Hamatonbetsu, Hokkaido
description: First morning in the new tent.  Long ride in the heat and sun.  Cow country.  New equipment disappointments.  Hokkaido Road shelters.  Spiders and hitchhikers.  Ja Youth.  Indigestion, boring ride, Seicomart and trying to eat healthy.  Fully booked hotel, so camp in the rain.

title: Sawaki, Hokkaido
description: A rainy morning and a misplaced tent location.  A dry hotel and a chance for a dry night.  A short episode today.

title: Sawaki, Hokkaido
description: Drying up the tent (what do you do in rainy weather?), crazy fly bite, bummed I am so out of shape, my on the road diet, smoking urge, Japanese politeness, wind testing the mic, scallop processing plants, odometer issues, lack of hotels, camping out.

title: Yubetsu, Hokkaido
description: Hating mosquitoes, planning the next few days ride, forest, hills and lots of bugs.  Big ass scallops, Scallop Mountains, car accidents, Lake Abashiri bike path, lots of bugs, Hokkaido lifestyle, trying to get a good dinner…

title: Arrived Shiretoko
description: Leaving the Rider House after some serious editing. Ride along the water, veal farm?, headed to the base of a mountain pass over the Shiretoko Penisula.  Noone wants Matt’s Reef Tank Tank… ☹ Waterfalls, small towns, Brown bear burgers, Game of thrones, deer, Jack Daniels and Coke.

title: DPRK Missile Flyover
description: North Korea missile launch over Hokkaido this morning, windy and rainy weather keeps me grounded for a day, Fish and Chips with no Fish or Chips, expensive seafood, leaving your panniers out, safe japan, changing my tone and perspective, looking for power.

title: Shiretoko Peninsula Cruise
description: Keeping yourself open to unexpected opportunities, took a sightseeing cruise up the Shiretoko Peninsula.  Bears, fjords, capes and Russia in the distance.  Thinking of every scenario.  Having some cool interactions with locals.  Onsen, sunsets and Laundry.

title: Shiretoko Peninsula Crossing
description: Leaving Shiretoko City, headed somewhat slowly over the Shiretoko Peninsula.  Trying to get ahead of the typhoon.  Lots of great DJI MAVIC drone footage along the way.  Cicadas along for the ride.  How the boats are preparing for the incoming typhoon.  The disputed Russian Kuril Islands.  A surprise visit from a member of the JaYoe Nation!  Throwing up after an amazing dinner…. Setting up camp in Shibetsu after a remarkable sunset while fighting off embolden foxes.

title: Shibetsu, Hokkaido
description: Great camp last night, free power woo hoo! Leaving the coast for a while and heading inland for a really long ride of 114km.  Today is all about pacing. More roadside generosity, getting more urban as I head south, witches brooms, crazy commenters and eating Japanese food… if I can afford it.

title: Kushiro Fireworks
description: Where did the typhoon go?????   Ooh well… I guess ill just enjoy the fireworks and people watch.

title: Japanese BBQ and Karaoke
description: I was supposed to only work in the hotel and prepare to get back on the road, but instead I was invited to join some of the Kushiro city officials and friends for outdoor BBQ and Karaoke.  I met the Mayor of the city and learned a little about Kushiro.

title: The Last Japan Coal Train
description: Visiting the last remaining working coal train and coal mine in Japan, in Kushiro City in southern Hokkaido.  It is interesting to see how the coal is harvested under the ocean, then delivered from the mine to the port via a specially designed short train trip.  Learn how the inside of the train works and how the excavators do their job under the ocean mine.  Also visit the largest wetland reserve as well, in Kushiro.

title: Otofuke
description: Leaving Kushiro to Otofuke, 130km ride.  Tires have been under deflated, so I fixed that problem.  Found a wallet in the road.  Zombie proof protest armored vehicles.  Getting philosophical about the idea of persistence using a flowing weed as an example.  Looking for Otofuke pork, got soup instead.

title: Traditional Japanese Ramen
description: Left a nice but expensive hostel in Otofuke, contacting the JNTO (Japanese National Tourism Organization) had an authentic Japanese ramen experience (with a lot of translation trouble), I have a travel channel opportunity, Osaka friend meet, taxi driver charity, Flying the drone over the Japanese Hokkaido countryside, having trouble finding a route over the mountain range, getting to the campsite late.

title: Sahoro
description: Waking up at camp after arriving in the dark the day before.  Taxi driver from yesterday sent me a message.  Flying the drone and driving thru the mountain range bisecting Hokkaido.  Ups and Downs.  Another road dead ends on me, but the dead end was a nice campground.  SO it worked out.  Bathing in a Hokkaido Mu Kawa river.

title: Shimupakku
description: Beautiful drone and ride out of the campsite road, on the way out of the Hokkaido Mountain pass.  Lots of tunnels and downhills, downpours and delays.  My Garmin 1000 edge odometer glitch.  Japan Police pull over.  Stopping for a curious family, complete with emu.

title: Chitose
description: Rainy ride, giving me a chance to test my rain protection.  Along the way I use my gopro in the rain during the ride, and talk about what a wet ride feels like.  Draining the swamp.  Arriving at Lake Toya.

title: Big Burger!
description: A real quick one while I take a few days in Lake Toya.  I found a great burger place, so I wanted to share it with you! Hydune: https://www.facebook.com/hydune.hydune/

title: North Korea Missle Warning
description: Received an interesting wake up call this morning... Alerts on my phone as well as the town PA system.  Strange world we live in.

title: My BBC Interview
description: This was my BBC Interview with the world NEWSDAY show. I recorded myself during the interview and laid over the audio.

title: Lake Toya
description: Woke up with a Missile alert from North Korea.  Supposed to ride out but instead made it a news day.  Found a good campsite (cheaper) and set up camp.  Camping can be a value compared to the prices of hotels in Japan.  My last interview gets cancelled.  News today and its effect on us as a fear tactic, when in reality we are living in a fairly peaceful time.  More ramen!  Cool ramen shop owner gave me a bean rice ball for the road.

title: Leaving Lake Toya
description: Leaving Lake Toya late, a ride taking me thru a ton of tunnels!  Bono glasses, Misu shiro, and some great roadside eats, more roadside kindness,  Campout at night.

title: Yakumo
description: Leaving the cool RV campsite, losing my hat, meeting some old cycling friends, street littler porn, cleaning bed city?, crap smelling area, roadside corn and ice crème, Windy arrival in Hakodate.

title: Hakodate
description: Leaving Hokkaido on a ferry to Aomori, meeting with an excited JaYoe fan before I go.  Great burgers at a Hokkaido burger chain Lucky Pierrot.  Maybe I can eat and review amazing burgers from around the world.  Uneventful ferry trip.  Am I on the mainland now?  Lost my chinese debit card.

title: Aomori
description: Leaving Aomori for the hills.  Trike is tweaked and repaired and doing great.  While going up and down, I run into a man that was very excited to show me some kendo!  How to stay motivated and on track to follow your dreams.  An amazing drone flight on the way down, with the day ending at an amazing campsite.

title: Hachinohe
description: Amazing Sunrise, flat tire in the morning, up and down thru the hills causing me to go slower than normal, strange bush art, tsunami levees and rebuilt communities.  Forgot my dinner, but no worries… it came to me, in the form of generosity.

title: Tanohata
description: Morning tsunami warning, tourist center wifi pitstops, tsunami reminders everywhere, feeling a bit blah and interested in the beauty around me, new communities, ride motivation, downhill riding on a trike, ups and downs of cycling the hills, big break walls, sacrificing views for safety, riding in the dark, stealth camping?

title: Yamada
description: Woke up to lots of dew, a day of break walls and big ups and downs.  I’m being hunted by a boy in a green suit… loosing my way around break wall construction.

title: Kesennuma
description: Leaving the hotel in Kesennuma, pushing thru and over the hills.  Sticking on the sidewalk, Utatsu tsunami damage, coming to terms with the past and the tragedy of what happened in the tsunami.  Putting things into perspective.  More roadside charity.

title: Roadside Spider Feeding
description: A quick addition to the vlog 242.  I was bored and so I found a weird morbid came to play with the spiders populating the side of the road.

title: ONAGAWA, JAPAN: After Tsunami Entrepreneurs
description: A tour of the local businesses that sprung up in the wake of the Tsunami in the town of Onagawa.  Camass business incubator, Sea Pineapples, Huge Onagawa Fish Bowl, rich rice, Specialty Soaps, beer soap, Ceramic tiles, Onagawa’s creative tsunami solution, Cardboard Lamborghinis, El Faro’s unique hotel concept and sinking my teeth into some fantastic beef tongue.

title: Japanese Fish Haul and Auction
description: Onagawa port, bringing in the Samma (Saury) and fish auction.  Meeting an interesting business idea in Onagawa before I leave.  Riding to Sendai, and meeting a local Italian Vlogger.

title: Matsushima
description: Sendai meet up with a vlogger friend, Tokyo bathroom innovations, free coffee location, head to Matsushima,  seeing my ride from the train, Japanese love ice cream, tunami?... Giovanni meets some of his fans, Japanese luck dolls (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daruma_doll), great local tuna sashimi, a surprise visit with another youtuber, VIVI Giapone.

title: Italian Vlogger in Japan: Calabrese in Oriente
description: In today’s VLOGGER 1 on 1, I meet Giovanni, or as people know his channel, calabrese in Oriente Giappone.  Giovanni is a Italian YouTuber that has been living in Sendai, Japan for 2 years.  His videos are raw, true and from a unique perspective of a foreigner living and working in Japan.  Join me as I have a conversation with him and learn what his life is like, and get a little in depth as to his past present and future on YouTube.

title: Youtuber in Japan: Davide of Vivi Giappone
description: In today’s VLOGGER 1 on 1, I meet Davide, or as people know his channel, Vivi Giappone.  Davide is a Italian YouTuber that has been living in Sendai, and producing videos about life there.  Davide likes to travel around Sendai and capture events, interviews and interesting sides of life in Japan.

title: Sendai
description: Leaving Sendai, headed to Minamisoma, where I will meet my friend James and head into the radiation zone around the Fukushima Diaichi site.  Repair my seat squeak. Met an amazingly friendly Iranian guy, and bought some throw away clothes for tomorrow.

title: Live Fukushima update
description: My friend James Oda is taking my trike and me on a tour of the Fukushima radiation zone.  We have a work van, protective gear and cameras ready.  Repurposing the low-lying areas for solar power.  Food and farming in a Fukushima zone.  The zone has opened previously off limits areas, so we tried to get an idea of what life is like in the irradiated zone.  Homes, Businesses, Schools, Cemeteries, Churches and the workers cleaning up and providing security to the areas.  Lots of workers with little to no safety gear manning checkpoints throughout the city.

title: Iwaki
description: Trying to get vlog motivated as I ride from Iwaki towards Tokyo.  Lots of spiders everywhere.  Rough roads.  Abandoned S E G A Store….

title: Hitachinaka
description: Crummy campsite, military helicopters, amine town, praying mantis buddies and more friendly drivers.

title: Tsuchiura
description: Riding to Tokyo, reigniting my vlog engine, getting to Japan

title: Tokyo with John Daub
description: Riding to Tokyo, reigniting my vlog engine, getting to Japan

title: Back to Japan
description: Head back to Japan, talk about my first time there, and plans for the restart.

title: Trikes, Friends and Fish and Chips in Tokyo
description: Pick up my trike, hoping that my spirits lift.  Tokyo is winding down, and meeting with John tomorrow.  Catching up with James and a strange vending machine, talking about the suicide forest, and meeting up with a friend of the Nation Jason.

title: Loaded and Ready to leave Tokyo
description: Another simple vlog as I get ready to leave Tokyo.  Check out my hostel/capsule hotel.  Meet with john. and Eva's first VLOG.

title: Leaving Tokyo...
description: Leaving Tokyo thru all the trump visit security.  I'm feeling way off…

title: New Cycling Buddy
description: Ran into a fellow cycle traveler and decided to join up our paths for a while. He is new to cycling and I gave him a few “newbie tips” and tried to bring his bike up to par.  I try out my new Nomad solar panel. (not super happy with it). Hakone Onsen, First time riding downhill on the trike.

title: Cycling up to Hakone
description: Up towards Hakone lake, we get caught up in the frustrations, pitfalls and joys of travel.  Some loss… a few stops, some beautiful autumn scenery but overall a good day.

title: Cycle to Fujikawaguchiko
description: Leaving Hakone bound for Mount Fuji views.  Early departure and clear weather.  Beautiful Views, Drone Shots, Bike Repairs and Mount Fuji climbing consideration.  My love of second hand shops.

title: LIVE on Mount Fuji
description: On Mount Fuji!  Climbing on a gorgeous day! Talk of my Patreon page, John and the steps that lead to the climb.

title: Summit Mount Fuji!
description: Climbing Mount Fuji in the offseason!   We caught an amazing weather window in November and took advantage of it to have an amazing summit experience on Fuji.  Everything worked in our favor, and the ascent was an inspiring experience for me and especially John, who not only had a once in a lifetime climb, but it was actually his first mountain!  JaYoe!

title: Driving with James
description: Leaving from Fujikawaguchi to Tokyo get my DJI Mavic looked at after crashing it into Fuji Mountain.  A visit to the Tokyo DJI store, Discussing the future of my ride thru Japan, the best kebab place in Tokyo, Ikebukuro, James Oda give me a ride back to Fuji.  Stories of suicide on the subway, in the forest, and a huge serial killer story currently in Japan.  Inspecting the entrance to the “Suicide Forest”.

title: Meeting TkyoSam
description: Picking up the drone from Tokyo, so I head back once more on a beautiful day.  November weather is great!  Meeting up with TkyoSam, a youtuber in Tokyo who has an interesting high energy channel.  He is a guy with a big personality and a goofy adult humor take on the subjects he covers.  We sit down, have some beers, make a y 1on1, and chat up people in the bar.

title: Vlogger 1on1 TkyoSam
description: In today’s VLOGGER 1 on 1, I meet with TKYOSAM.  Gritty, Funny, Off color, and Hardcore, Sam is a guy that speaks his mind... his dirty… dirty mind.  And although he might not be everyone’s cup of high octane tea, he has made a name for himself on Youtube.  We met up in the downtown Ikebukuro district of Tokyo, to learn a bit more about his channel, where he started and where he is going.

title: My Ride Kit
description: As we prepare to leave Fujikawaguchiko, I repack my gear to get back on the road.  Check out my method for packing, and get a once over on what I carry where.  Also join me for a communal curry dinner at the Fuji View K’s Hostel.

title: Japan’s Suicide Forest
description: Argentinian mate tea.  Autumn festival at Kawaguchi Lake.  Fresh wasabi.  Hot peppers.  Cute dogs.  Beautiful changing colors.  Traveling to the Aokigahara forest, AKA the suicide forest.  Exploring the forest, and finding remnants of potentially lost travellers.  Background and history of the forest, and the area where people go in.   Amazing free onsen/spa.  Spooky run down store.  Conquering fear and understanding the light that comes after the darkest storms

title: Ride to Fuji City
description: Forbidden  Lobby camping.  Lobby for loosers.com.  Great ride around a rare active Mount Fuji.  Yellow submarines.  Lake motosuke and the 1000 Yen view.  A 35 km downhill.  Trying to get my trike on a train.

title: Tour of Kyoto
description: Hitching a ride to Kyoto…. Thanks to James.  Upon arrival, we took a took around the area.  TIJ – This is Japan.  TIK – This is Kyoto.  Moving the capital to Tokyo.  Bamboo scaffolding.  Geisha.

title: Vlogger 1on1 John Wu
description: In today’s VLOGGER 1 on 1 I say hello and goodbye to my cycling friend John.  While we were together riding thru Japan he decided to start a  Youtube channel and become a vlogger, and so I figured this might be a unique opportunity to chronicle a potential birth of a new vlogger.  If he sticks with it and goes the distance this will become an interesting video showing the beginning of an amazing channel focused on the traveling lifestyle of John Wu.

title: Solving the Problem with North Korea
description: Many people have asked me my opinion on North Korea as I have experience in North Korea, South Korea, Japan, China and America. I have one idea, and although it is far fetched I think it just might work if people could put aside their differences and work together.  Anyway, this is my thoughts on the matter, however far-fetched it is.

title: Bendit Cycling Recumbent Clothing
description: I just wanted to make a quick video about Bendit cycling.  They make the pants and shorts I wear, and I think they deserve a shout out.  I was not paid for this video… just wanted to say thanks for making some cool gear.

title: See ya John!... Hello Osaka
description: Saying goodbye to john… and hello to old friends in Osaka.  With a ton of gates in between.

title: Osaka Aquarium
description: Trip to the Osaka Aquarium.  One of the biggest in the world.

title: Riding to Himeji
description: Riding thru cities on my way from Osaka to Himeji.  Traveling thru cities is a balance between patience and creativity.  Interesting Motorbikes.  Stealing a glance.  Arriving at Himeji.

title: Rainy in Himeji
description: A short one while I sweat out bad weather and snoring.

title: Himeji Castle Quick Tour
description: Interesting Hostel last night.  Riding in Holiday traffic.  Himeji Castle Quick Tour.  No Drones.  Remembering the castle in historical context.  GODAI DRUG store.  Long and cold ride thru the country and city.  Quest for shoes.

title: Okayama
description: Leaving Okayama (the hippie paradise) to Onomichi, listening to podcasts, my shoes are failing, Okonomiyaki.

title: Cycling the Shimanami Kaido
description: Cycling from Honshu to Shikoku in Japan, an amazing stretch of islands and bridges linking the two landmasses.  Making it even more awesome, I got some wonderful drone shots, told some fun stories, and met some incredible fellow cyclists.

title: Looking for Ancestors at the Itsukushima Shrine
description: James Oda has some ancestors with a connection to the Itsukushima shrine, so I took a trip there to check out his contribution to one of the three most famous views in all of Japan.

title: Hiroshima Bomb Tour
description: I took a short walk around Hiroshima, introducing you to the physical remnants of the moment that shaped Japan, and what it looks like today.

title: Amazing Japanese Roadside Kindness
description: Leaving J-hoppers Hiroshima, headed to a ferry… then Shikoku…. Then a ferry… then Kyushu.  Leaving my Garmin on for the #relive.  Some talk about my “ism” editing.  AMAZING ROADSIDE CHARITY.

title: Cycling is a lot like life
description: Usuki to Nobeoka, thru mountains and a ton of tunnels.  Shirt ideas.. “cycling is a lot like life.. “  Sock theory. Beautiful countryside drone shots.  Arkel pannier misplacement.  Country bugs.  The joy of completing a daily mission.

title: Cycling Japan | Ride Commentary
description: Riding from Nobeoka to Miyakonojo, I throw together a bunch of commentaries while I try to make 135km.  Bigotry, Japanese driving etiquette, happy kids and Instagram.

title: Cycling to Kagoshima
description: Miyakonojo to Kagoshima, the next steps of my journey.  Upset stomach.  Great Japanese Bathroom.  A long day.  Happy drivers.

title: Cycling around Sakurajima Volcano
description: Riding around Kagoshima’s Sakurajima’s Volcano.  Some drone flying… some eruption remnants… some nice people and a trip to the ferry to take my to Okinawa.

title: Vlogger 1on1 |  John Daub
description: In today’s VLOGGER 1 on 1, I meet John Daub, or as people know his channel, Only in Japan or Only in Japan GO.  John has lived in Japan for 20 years, and in doing so has been able to become a primary voice showcasing culture, locations and interesting sides of Tokyo and Japan at large.  We discuss his past, present and future, look at his motivations for producing his channel, and talk gear.  And stick to the end, John will try the trike.

title: Arriving Okinawa by ferry
description: The 25-hour ferry ride from Kagoshima to Okinawa dropped me off on the island to some beautiful weather.  And I got some great Okinawa grub for my first dinner.

title: Military bases, American Village and the Lighthouse
description: Cycling around Okinawa, finding comparisons with Japan, checking out the Military bases and American Village.  Meeting a friend of the Nation Jason, and having a really big burger, checking out the Cape Zampa Lighthouse

title: Homes for free in Paradise, Castles and Small Islands
description: talked about Okinawa food, bounced over some outer islands, and talked about farming, graffiti and the decreasing populations in Okinawa, opening up some interesting opportunities for getting some free real estate in paradise. Ohh... and Red Lobster.

title: Trikes on a Plane to Taiwan!
description: Flying with the trike (the Tiger Duck) for free!  Leaving Okinawa and Japan behind early in the morning, bound for Taiwan.  Learning how traffic works outside Japan and Korea… again…  Peach Airlines.  Taiwan impressions… leaving the airport… dealing with rain… meeting my friend David and his cute daughter Angel.  JaYoe Nation in Taiwan.  The Podride and making Taiwan a cycling theme.  Noodles, nangan and amazing Taiwan Hot Pot.

title: JaYoe Japan Q&A LiveStream
description: I have finished cycling from Hokkaido to Okinawa over the last few months. Ask me questions about my trip and my impressions of Japan throughout my journey!  This live stream will last as long as it takes... so ask away as I chew away at the service on my phone.

title: Taipei food, coffee and an acoustic Christmas Serenade
description: Some interesting Taiwanese/American breakfast.  Coffee Shops, Acoustic Christmas Music courtesy of Vivien Loh, and some Taiwanese dinner.

title: Dropping off the trike in Taipei
description: Dropping off the “tiger duck” at Velo City.  Riding around Taipei a bit and learning about the cycling rules.  Planning out the future of returning.  Knock off KFC’s (KLG), Taiwan Hooters, Ebike training wheels?, visiting the Future Forward Maker space and business incubator and set up the beginning steps to giving a lecture there.  Getting gifts.

title: Tour a strange Mall in Kunming, China
description: Leaving Ningbo to Kunming, with a couple false starts.  Ningbo Airport to Kunming International, spending one night before heading to Tengchong.  But while we were in the Howard Johnson, Ruby, Tom and I tour a very interesting albeit uniquely stocked Mall.  Wood Carvings, Pipes, Decor and a plethora of interesting Food and Medicine to sample.

title: Strange China Resort
description: Flying from Kunming to Tengchong, we travel to the Lost Stone Resort and Hotel.  Interesting feeding Koi fish, Anny’s Moon Song, most of the resort is empty.

title: Christmas Eve in Yunnan, China
description: Christmas Eve in TengChong, Yunnan, China.  An interesting trip up to a Taoist temple, an amazing vegetarian meal, some great drone shots and a special Christmas Eva on Christmas Eve.… ;)

title: Christmas Day in Tengchong, Yunnan, China
description: Christmas in Tengchong, traveling to a new hotel and settling into a new locale.  Some Tengchong history during WW2.  Eva is coming down with a cold… and we explore the new town.

title: Chinese Traditional Market Streets
description: Eva not feeling too good, but we have a big day.  So big I have to cut up this vlog into a few pieces.  First Piece, The Tengchong Chinese market streets, and an awesome lunch.

title: China’s Volcanic Field
description: A trip to the Tengchong Geothermic Park, and really interesting and entertaining walk thru a unique place on a beautiful day. The Tengchong volcanic field is a volcanic field located in Baoshan City in Yunnan, China, about 40 km from the Chinese border with Myanmar.  Funny Chinese misspellings.  Fart wingman.  Cooking eggs in volcanic vents.  Fertility wells.

title: 280 Year Old Chinese Courtyard Restaurant
description: A truly unique eating experience in Tengchong, Yunnan, China.  A 280 year old converted Chinese Courtyard Restaurant.   You eat what they give you… and it’s all amazing.

title: Xiamen, China
description: Back into China via Xiamen. Let's head back to pick up the original path!

title: Guilin.... Finally!
description: Finally arriving to Guilin.... putting the accident behind me, I can get back on the original path!

title: Nanning, China
description: This will be the city I will stage my next big move from, exiting China.  From here it is a relative hop to the border of Vietnam... here we go!  Will I have border trouble?  Will I have any visa issues?  How will the cycle hold up by this time?  I am sure all will be well, but the trip is going to take a major step forward.

title: Hanoi, Vietnam
description: Into Vietnam I go.  I have never been to this country before, so this will be uncharted territory.  From what I have heard, people are nice, and the landscape is lush, but traffic can be treacherous.  What will I learn here?  What odd job can I fill?  What wonderful friends will I make?

title: Vang Vieng, Laos
description: Vang Vien is known for being a bit of a party town.  A meandering river cuts it way thru the jungle, allowing vacationers to drink and party all the way down.  As I cut into the country. This may be a place to enjoy life a little.  It would be nice to experience this area from a different perspective.  Maybe I can get a job along the river, catering to insane travelers.

title: Da Nang, Vietnam
description: From Laos I head back into Vietnam.  I figure it would be a good ride to follow the east coast.  I have a vision of waking up in a hammock strung up between a couple trees along side a beach.  Getting in the water and swimming a couple kilometers before cleaning up and getting on my way again.

title: Phan Rang
description: Wrapping around the east coast heading to the south end of the country, at some point turning west.  Headed to the Capital.

title: Ho Chi Minh
description: The capital of Vietnam.  A big crowded city with lots of nooks and crannies.  A city with a rock solid culture and a turbulent history.... lets explore, eat... and live like a local for a bit.  JaYoe!

title: Crossing Cambodia
description: Into and out of Cambodia.  I hear that the people here are some of the most friendly in South East Asia.  Im looking forward to seeing that for myself.

title: Bangkok, Thailand
description: I have been to Thailand before.  I love it.  Its hot, subtropical, the people are great and the food is exquisite.  On top of all of this the prices are low.  Bangkok is an amazing city with great stories.  It can be a place to party, worship, or just hang around.  I am not sure, but I may take some time to visit some friends I have on the Island of Koh Samui.  DS.. here I come!

title: Phuket
description: Its always a party in Phuket!

title: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: Welcome to KL.

title: Singapore
description: Small country with a big personality.  I'm interested to triking this country.

title: Batam Port
description: From Batam I hop on a ferry to Indonesia.

title: Jakarta, Indonesia
description: A big city in a HUGE island country.  My jumping off point for a long island hopping adventure.

title: Bali, Indonesia
description: Bali.... spring break island and beautiful tropical paradise.

title: Gili Island
description: My friend told me if I was in the area I MUST go to Gili.... so here we go!

title: Dili, East Timor
description: Small country.... i have very little knowledge about.

title: Darwin, Australia
description: Somehow I need to find my way to Darwin so I can start my Aussi part of the JaYoe World Tour.  Ill start by heading west...... and work my way around.

title: Coral Bay
description: Curving around the country.

title: Sydney
description: Explore Sydney, then board a ferry to New Zealand

title: Queenstown, New Zealand
description: Arrive in NZ..... this is going to be an adventure!

title: Brisbane, Australia
description: Back to OZ.... completing the circle.

title: Port Douglas
description: Jumping off Australia.... headed to another island hopping adventure.

title: Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea
description: I have no idea what this place is... but i have heard it is amazing.

title: Bitung, Indonesia
description: Bounding my way west.... ferry ferry ferry

title: Tawau, Malaysia
description: I think i can find my way to the island part of Malaysia... and head west....

title: Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei
description: An extremely isolated country.... it would be a very cool addition to the trip.  Lets see if i can get in.

title: Mersing, Malaysia
description: Back to the mainland.... time to head north!

title: Koh Samui, Thailand
description: Steve.... im crashing on your couch.... ;)

title: Chiang Mai
description: Northern Thailand, or so i have heard, is completely different from southern.  I have explored the southern half a few times, and i hope i can get up into the northern stretches and high altitudes of Chiang Mai and see what life is like up there.  It will be good training for Everest in a few months either way!

title: Myanmar...?
description: If the trip worked like i wish it did, i would be able to traverse the country to Myanmar.  Realistically, i think that Visa restrictions will make entering the east and exiting the west all but impossible.  But life is an amazing adventure, and we shall see.

title: Top of India
description: Find a way around or thru Myanmar headed towards the ultimate destination, the Himalayas.  I would love to be able to cross Myanmar... its supposed to be beautiful.  But VISA issues may make riding thru you impossible.

title: Bangladesh
description: have some friends in Bangladesh.  Most of the country's roads are crowded and/or in rough shape.  We will have to see how I make my way.

title: Kathmandu
description: Making my way to Kathmandu will be cathartic.  As it will be after i have climbed Everest.  Interesting juxtaposition of two times.  One time climbing to the top and another riding to see my old friends from my climb.

title: South into India
description: From the world's highest peak I head south into India again.  Back into the heat, the culture, and the yogurt.... yum!  I wonder how the "come down", pardon the pun, will be after climbing in the Himalayas.... JaYoe!

title: East Coast of India
description: Riding down the East Coast of India.  The sighs, the sounds, the hustle bustle of one of the most populous countries going about their lives.

title: Madurai, India
description: I need to cross over into Sri Lanka at this point.  It will have been a long ride south at this moment.

title: Sri Lanka
description: An Island country just waiting for me to circumvent.  Maybe I should skip the trike and ride an elephant....

title: Back to India again
description: Back to India again, and moving south to the tip of the country

title: Southern Tip of India
description: Down, down, down to the south of India.  Ill wave hello to the Maldives to the south, and then turn up the west coast, leaving the east behind.

title: Up the West Coast
description: Cruising up the east coast of India, its a long stretch.  I want to absorb the culture here.  Practice my yoga, meditation, and wake up along the sea to face another day.

title: Turn Inland
description: At some point I am going to have to start heading inland, towards Acra and the Taj Mahal.  Here may be as good a place as any.

title: Taj Mahal, India
description: The Taj is amazing.  I was in India once before and missed my chance to visit.  This time I am not going to miss the chance to look and feast my eyes on this impressive structure.

title: Pakistan
description: Pakistan has a bad rap in the world community.  But from what I have heard from fellow travelers is that Pakistan is an amazing place with beautiful landscapes and amazing culture.

title: Moving Thru Iran
description: I have a good friend here from the northern part of Iran.  I hope I can meet up with him and spend some time making my way thru the country.

title: Out of Iran
description: Iran will end with me crossing into Saudi Arabia.  Ill need to catch a ferry or some sort of transportation... and get over to Dubai.  See ya Shah, my friend!

title: Dubai - UAE
description: I hear it is hot here.  Like HOT HOT.  like HOT HOT HOT... but let me see for myself.  The other thing I hear is that it is beautiful!

title: Jeddah, Saudi Arabia
description: Start making my way south, out of Dubai and Into Jeddah.  I have to cross the Saudi Desert.  I hear that I may need to have an escort thru the desert.  Should be interesting.

title: Port Sudan, Red Sea
description: Into Port Sudan.  I have heard that the Red Sea is one of the world's best diving spots.  I have also heard that Sudan is one of the worlds worst tourist destinations....   Hope the diving rumor is right.

title: Luxor, Egypt
description: Egypt is a hotbed of trouble now, but I hope that it cools down so I can experience the glory of Egypt's amazing treasures.

title: Cairo, Egypt
description: Thru into Cairo.  Beating the heat and cruising past the sphinx.

title: Amman, Jordan
description: Moving my way thru the volatile cluster of amazing and historical countries.  Hope I don't have many VISA problems.

title: Beirut, Lebanon
description: Into Lebanon.  To be honest i don't know much more about it than i have heard in the news... but i am sure most of that is wayyyy offf.

title: Cyprus
description: Cyprus, my jumping off point to Istanbul.  It doesn't hurt that it is supposed to be overwhelmingly beautiful.

title: Istanbul, Turkey
description: I have a good friend in Istanbul from my time in China.  I have to hit him up for  a nice tour of his country.... Looking forward to seeing you and your homeland my old friend.

title: Bulgaria
description: After Istanbul I am headed out into Bulgaria.  What will I see, do, and learn here?

title: Bucharest, Romania
description: Then Romania.  I need to brush up on my Romanian.

title: Moldova
description: Moldova.... beauty and suprises.

title: Odesa, Ukraine
description: Ukraine, Ukraine, Ukraine... Please settle down so I can enjoy your country.

title: Vinnytsia, Ukraine
description: If all goes well, I can cruise up into the heart of Ukraine and enjoy the country a little more.  Then head west into some of the other Slavic countries.

title: Slovakia
description: Into Slovakia.  Another place i have very little first hand knowledge of.... that will change.

title: Budapest, Hungary
description: Beautiful, green and interesting

title: Vienna, Austria
description: Thru Austria.  What can I learn here?  What will I know?  What will I do?

title: Slovenia
description: Its funny.... as i write this.. i am trying to figure out things to talk about.  But i am at a loss... i don't know much about these places, which makes the excitement all the more palpable.

title: Zagreb, Croatia
description: Looks Pretty Nice...   Looking forward to checking it out myself.

title: Sarajevo
description: Lots of interesting stories out of this place...  I hope to write some stories of me and Bosnia myself.

title: Tirana, Albania
description: Maybe I can brush up on my hiking and climbing skills here.

title: Athens, Greece
description: I am excited about many things with regards to Greece.  The food.. the beaches... the history... the women... all of the above.

title: Pilos, Greece
description: Hitting the southern tip of Greece, I need to find a way to cross over to Malta.  Excuse me... beautiful yacht in the Mediterranean... can I hitch a ride?

title: Malta
description: A small luxurious island off the southern tip of Italy.  Sounds good to me.  I would not mind living the fishing life for a little while.

title: Southern Italy
description: Ahhh... Italy!  I can't wait...

title: Cosenza, Italy
description: Winding up the East coast of Italy north.

title: Florence, Italy
description: The streets of florence in the evening.... I'm so looking forward to this.

title: Zurich, Switzerland
description: Home of secure bank accounts and extreme sports!

title: Munich, Germany
description: Back into germany

title: Honningsvåg, Norway
description: Up Up Up to the top of Norway.  I may even try to get a closer look nearer to the north pole.

title: Stjordal, Norway
description: At some point i need to cross into Iceland.  Another JaYoe mission.

title: Iceland
description: Volcanos, alien landscapes, tundra, and a beautiful ride around a beautiful island.

title: Faroe Islands
description: Stop in at the Faroe Islands on my way back to the mainland.

title: Oslo, Norway
description: Into Oslo.  I have always heard its an amazing city... time to see it for myself.  Thanks to Øystein s.Hansen for the picture.

title: Kriftel, Germany
description: Here I will swing past the builders of the Scorpion trike.... hope it makes it here all in one piece.  but i am sure it will.... Its German Engineering after all!

title: Amsterdam, The Netherlands
description: I have a very good friend that comes from this place. He has helped me a lot with my website and he is also traveling around the world. I'm really looking forward to meeting him, maybe he can show me around his country and the bikes. Holland has more bikes than people.. can you believe that???

title: Paris, France
description: A city of romance... culture... and a bit messy.  or so i have heard.  Ill have to give it a whirl.

title: Casablanca, Morocco
description: Will it be like the movies?  I think not.  But it will still be awesome.  And I will catch up with some old friends.

title: Laayoune
description: Move from Africa off land for a trip to the Canary Islands

title: Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe
description: FYI.... the VIctoria Falls are on the border between Zimbabwe and Zambia...  I was ignorantly stating that they were in Zambia but was corrected... thanks Rodney. :)

title: Nicaragua
description: For some reason I always think of the A-team when I think about this country.  Wierd...

title: Honduras
description: A crazy airport.  But a special place none the less.

title: Cancún, Mexico
description: Beautiful beaches, spectacular diving and beautiful women in bikinis... what more do you want?

title: Cave of Swallows
description: Something I have dreamt of for as long as I can remember.  Of course before it was a dream, but soon it will be a reality.  Base jumping into the cave of swallows.

title: Mexican Border
description: One of the most fearful moments of the whole trip will be moments from the american border... I really hope there will be no giant wall towering in front of me when I arrive here...

title: New Orleans, LA
description: Mardi Gras... anyone?

title: Appalachian Trail
description: I may have to lose the bike to do this... but walking the appalachian trial would be a spectacular trip.

title: New York
description: The big apple welcomes me back.

title: Detroit, Michigan
description: My hometown.  Coming back into this city after such an amazing trip... it makes me wonder.  Who will I be?  What stories will I tell my parents?  How will I view my life at this moment? The homestretch lies ahead.  A little bit more and I will have achieved my goal.  JaYoe!

title: Los Angeles, CA
description: The end of a long long long journey.  It's at this point that I will need to decide if i have the energy remaining to go up into Canada... then Alaska... cross the Bering Strait into Russia... then back to China... making a big loop.  What do you think?

title: Chengdu
description: Chengdu is well known for two things in particular... Pandas and Hot Pot.  Anny and I stopped here on the way back from Mountain Climbing Muztagh Ata!

title: Muztagh Ata
description: Join Anny and I as we try to break the 7000m barrier and climb Muztagh Ata.  Its remote, but it's one of the tallest mountains in the world.  Edging close to Tajikistan, Pakistan and Kazakstan... it truly is an interesting place!

title: Quick tour of Xi'an
description: a trip to Xi'an for a quick tour of the Terracotta soldiers and to see the city wall.

title: YuZhuFeng Mountain
description: My second attempt at high altitude climbing.  this time 6300 meters.  Lots of fun, some challenge.. but Anny really shined... Mind over matter!

title: HABA Mountain
description: training to climb Everest, getting my high altitude feet wet with HABA mountain.  5396 Meters to the top!

title: the SPEZI Show
description: A visit to the SPEZI Special Bike Show!

title: Pyongyang, North Korea
description: An interesting trip to a surprising place.  North Korea.  Yup... an American from Detroit is going to run in the streets of the capital, Pyongyang!

title: Hong Kong
description: While in Shenzhen i took a jump over to Hong Kong.  Hong Kong is a great place to get paperwork done, and i took this opportunity to get my Vietnamese VISA.  Of course HK is a lot more than just VISAs... but i am running short on time and was not able to take advantage of my stay here as much as i would have liked.

title: Ganzhou Grottos
description: A great day trip to see nature and culture that's trip close to the heart of Ganzhou.

title: Mirihi, Maldives
description: This is off the path of the main trip, but it is still important.  I made my first JaYoe Travelogue here.  Take a look!

title: Guangzhou, China
description: This was one of the first locations I arrived at that was not completely under the power of the trike.  Instead i took a short trike ride to the bus station, loaded the trike under a bus and rode to the main guangzhou station, and then took the trike onto the subway to the canton fair.  It was definitely a test of alternative transportation with a trike. :)

title: HP Velotechnik OHG
description:
HP Velotechnik OHG |
Kapellenstrasse 49  65830 Kriftel Germany |
Tel +49 - 61 92 - 97 99 2 - 0 |
Fax +49 - 61 92 - 97 99 2 - 299 |

description:
VELTOP
http://www.veltop.eu/us/
Stéphane
DELERY
contact@cyclo-system.com
CYCLO-SYSTEM
3621 route d'Albertville
74320 SEVRIER FRANCE

Tel: 0033 (0) 4 50 77 56 17
Fax: 0033 (0) 4 50 63 45 36
http://www.veltop.eu

title: Mount Everest Summit
description: Well... it was an amazing adventure for sure.  I finished my expedition in 2016 and have been able to give it my all to climb the tallest mountain in the world.  I will be forever thankful for the opportunity, and will make it my goal to return someday to finish the job!

title: Adventures Global
description:
Adventures Global Pty Ltd | 
Ronnie Muhl | 
PO Box 405, Simon’s Town 
CAPE TOWN 7995 | 
enquiries@adventuresglobal.net | 
[fax] (+27) 086 575 0187 
[phone] +27) 21 786 4990

title: Mount Hallasan
description: A hike up to the top of Mount Hallasan in the center of Jeju Island.

title: Black Pork Restaurant 흑돈 향 흑돼지
description:
Black Pork Specialty Restaurant 흑돈 향 흑돼지 
PHONE: 0507-1401-5115 
ADDRESS: 제주 특별 자치도 서귀포시 태평로 58

title: Skywalker Guesthouse, Jeju
description: A budget Guesthouse in downtown Jeju, a good place to chill for a night or two.

title: Fishing on Lake Shumarinai
description: An awesome adventure on a beautiful lake.

title: Hiking Rishiri Fuji Mountain
description: I had an awesome hike/climb above the clouds to the peak of Rishiri Fuji

title: Winter Swim Yellow River
description: Some friends and I were invited to swim across the Yellow River in Qinghai Province in central China.  A freezing cold 500 meter swim across a swift flowing river, around the birth point of the famed Yellow River.

title: TravelingTice
description:
TravelingTice is a guy who is attempting to cycle in every country in the world. An insane guy with an insane dream! He has helped me remake this website and improve the quality so it can be reached by more people! I think him for all of the work he has put into this website. Thanks Matthijs! 
 Link to his Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/travelingtice
